revised_title: Observing the Total Solar Eclipse of 1898 in Sahdol, Central India
tldr: In 1898, a team of astronomers led by W. H. M. Christie and H. H. Turner embarked on an expedition to Sahdol, Central India, to observe the total solar eclipse of January 22. The team faced challenges such as clearing a jungle site for their camp and dealing with unfavorable weather conditions. Despite these obstacles, they successfully observed and documented the eclipse, contributing to the understanding of solar eclipses and the advancement of astronomical research.
